page.title: 12ELLISTONE FARM - STAINLAND
page.content: Ellistone Farm is in the middle of { {Stainland}village. We visited this farm because it is typical of farms in our area. It is owned by Crowther's. Ellistone Farm was built in 1606 and is a cattle farm. The cattle are bred for beef and dairy products. The dairy cows are called Friesans. The cows have to be milked twice a day. At this farm the milking takes a long time because the milking parlour has only room for four cows at a time, and there are 60 cows to milk in summer and 110 cows in winter. To milk the cows the farmer puts glass pipes on to the cows' udders, the milk flows through the pipes into two big tanks. Here the milk is stored until the milk tanker collects it and takes it to{Longley Farm}near Holmfirth where it is made into cottage cheese and yoghurt.
